titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: John E. Willard (1908-1996) was a professor of chemistry at the University of Wisconsin (1937-1979) whose research included radiation chemistry, photochemistry, the chemical effects of nuclear transformations, and the nature and reactions of trapped intermediates. Early in his career (1935-1937) he was an instructor at Haverford College.

scopecontent.p: These papers illustrate Professor Willard's long association with the American Chemical Society (ACS) and other national and international scientific bodies, documenting various meetings, both national and international, in which he participated or which he helped to organize. One group is concerned with the organizational meeting of the Section on Nuclear Chemistry of the International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry (IUPAC) in New York in 1951; Professor Willard was the secretary. Willard was also an officer for most of the post-war period of the Division of Physical and Inorganic Chemistry of the ACS; thus one group of papers represent records and correspondence of the Division. There are also summaries of the research of Professor Willard's group at the University of Wisconsin. [Photographs,] lists of attendees and programs of the Gordon Research Conference on Nuclear (later Radiation) Chemistry from 1951 constitute another group.

controlaccess.corpname: American Chemical Society. Division of Physical and Inorganic Chemistry.
International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry.
controlaccess.subject: Chemistry--Societies, etc.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: A paper finding aid is available in the repository.
